info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 11:40AM PST until March 06 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except up to 18 inches in the higher terrain above 4500 feet. * WHERE...For the South Central Siskiyou County, including the Mt Shasta region and I-5 from Black Butte Summit southward and Highway 89 from Snowman Summit to McCloud and Pondosa. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Snow will continue into late this afternoon resulting in snow covered roads and difficult travel. There should be a break tonight, but additional heavy snow will occur Tuesday through Wednesday morning with limited visibility and snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent, or likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
